casebody.data:
Maurice G. HARGROVE, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. CITY OF MONTGOMERY, ALABAMA, Phoukam Sichanthavong, Defendants-Appellees. No. 12-12802

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. Nov. 29, 2012. Elizabeth Peyton Faulk, Bush & Faulk, LLC, Anthony B. Bush, Lewis, Bush & Faulk, LLC, Montgomery, AL, for Plaintiff-Appellant. Jason Cole Paulk, City Attorney’s Office, Montgomery, AL, for Defendants-Ap-pellees. Before TJOFLAT, KRAVITCH, and HILL, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:

This is an appeal from the grant of defendants/appellees’s, the City of Montgomery, Alabama, and former Montgomery police officer, Phoukam Sichantha-vong’s (Sichanthavong), motion for summary judgment against plaintiff'appellant, Maurice Hargrove (Hargrove), on his numerous causes of action claims relating to a law enforcement encounter between Hargrove and Sichanthavong in the parking lot of a local bank, as Sichanthavong attempted to respond to a nearby bank robbery.

We have reviewed the record in this appeal, the briefs, and the argument of counsel. Finding no error, we affirm the judgment of the district court.

AFFIRMED.
